intro: Opsantha amarella, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. The flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
